channel.title: Law&Crime Network
channel.description:
During the defamation trial on Wednesday, a pre-recorded deposition of Alejandro Romero, the front desk employee at Johnny Depp's penthouse, was played in court. Romero was questioned about the penthouse incident and about what he saw occur around the time. During his testimony, Romero's responses made Depp and other members of the court laugh.
#JohnnyDepp #AmberHeard

item.description:
After court on Wednesday, Johnny Depp fans shouted at Amber Heard as she left the court house. There have been many supporters for both Heard and Depp outside of the Fairfax County Courthouse everyday during the trial. Depp supporters can be heard shouting, Amber why you gotta poop on the bed as she leaves the courthouse.
#JohnnyDepp #AmberHeard
item.title: Why you gotta poop on the bed? Fans Shout at Amber Heard as She Leaves Courthouse

item.description:
During his testimony on Thursday, Starling Jenkins testified about the incident of a surprise left in Johnny Depp's bed and the events leading up to it. Jenkins stated that Amber Heard called the situation a horrible practical joke gone wrong.

item.description:
During his testimony on Thursday, Johnny Depp's business manager testified that Depp's outstanding liabilities were more than his income and assets. In layman's terms, Depp was spending more than he was bringing in.
#JohnnyDepp #AmberHeard

item.title: Johnny Depp's Debt Outweighed His Income Says Business Manager

item.description:
During the defamation trial on Wednesday, a pre-recorded deposition of Christian Carino was played for the court. Carino, Depp's former agent, stated that he believed that Depp lost his role in Pirates of the Caribbean 6 because of Amber Heard's Op-Ed. He spoke about the complications that the op-ed caused for Johnny and his career.
#JohnnyDepp #AmberHeard

item.title: Johnny Depp Lost Pirates Role Because of Amber Heard's Op-Ed Says Depp's Agent

item.description:
During his pre-recorded deposition on Thursday, ACLU COO Terence Dougherty testified that Amber Heard removed Johnny Depp's name from her op-ed after a suggestion from her editors. Dougherty also spoke about how Heard had nothing to do with the op-ed headline, stating the Washington Post editorial team wrote it without approval from the ACLU or Heard.
#AmberHeard #JohnnyDepp #ACLU

item.title: Amber Heard Removed Johnny Depp's Name From Her Op-Ed After Suggestion

item.description:
During a pre-recorded deposition on Wednesday, Johnny Depp struggled to stop laughing while the witness gave his testimony. One of the sentences to had Depp laughing was, in the words of the witness, I don't remember, I don't even remember what I had for breakfast.
#JohnnyDepp #Laughing #Testimony
